text.0: bring adoration ample and most excellent hymn offerings to the watchful twain the bountiful your sweetest to the bounteous ones.
text.1: sovrans adored with streams of oil and praised at every sacrifice.
text.2: their high imperial might may nowhere be assailed neer may their godhead be assailed.
text.3: for the broad sun was seen a path more widely laid the path of holy law hath been maintained with rays the eye with bhagas rays of light.
text.4: firmset in heaven is mitras home and aryamans and varuṇas.
text.5: thence they give forth great vital strength which merits praise high power of life that men shall praise.
text.6: with aditi the luminous the celestial upholder of the people come ye day by day ye who watch sleepless day by day.
text.7: resplendent might have ye obtained Ādityas lords of liberal gifts.
text.8: movers of men mild both are mitra varuṇa mover of men is aryaman.
text.9: this soma be most sweet to mitra varuṇa he in the drinkingfeasts shall have a share thereof sharing a god among the gods.
text.10: may all the gods of one accord accept it joyfully today.
text.11: therefore do ye o kings accomplish what we ask ye righteous ones whateer we ask.
text.12: whoso with worship serves mitra and varuṇa him guard ye carefully uninjured from distress guard from distress the liberal man.
text.13: aryaman guards him well who acts uprightly following his law.
text.14: who beautifies their service with his lauds who makes it beautiful with songs of praise.
text.15: worship will i profess to lofty dyaus to heaven and earth to mitra and to bounteous varuṇa the bounteous the compassionate.
text.16: praise indra praise thou agni praise bhaga and heavenly aryaman.
text.17: long may we live and have attendant progeny have progeny with somas help.
text.18: with the gods help with indra still beside us may we be held selfsplendid with the maruts.
text.19: may agni mitra varuṇa give us shelter this may we gain we and our wealthy princes.
